conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows down from A, positioned above the red baffle, likely following the path directly downward.
Liquid flows down from B, positioned above the green baffle, likely following the path directly downward.
Liquid flows down from C, positioned above the yellow baffle, likely following the path directly downward.
Baffles are positioned to direct the flow of liquid towards specific containers.
Red baffle is aligned with container E.
Green baffle is aligned with container F.
Yellow baffle is aligned with container G.
Liquid from A flows down past the red baffle into container E.
Liquid from B flows down past the green baffle into container F.
Liquid from C flows down past the yellow baffle into container G.
A will flow into E, B will flow into F, C will flow into G.
